title:
OnionVQE Optimization Strategy for Ground State Preparation on NISQ
  Devices
authors:
Katerina Gratsea, Johannes Selisko, Maximilian Amsler, Christopher
  Wever, Thomas Eckl, Georgy Samsonidze
abstract:
The Variational Quantum Eigensolver (VQE) is one of the most promising and
widely used algorithms for exploiting the capabilities of current Noisy
Intermediate-Scale Quantum (NISQ) devices. However, VQE algorithms suffer from
a plethora of issues, such as barren plateaus, local minima, quantum hardware
noise, and limited qubit connectivity, thus posing challenges for their
successful deployment on hardware and simulators. In this work, we propose a
VQE optimization strategy that builds upon recent advances in the literature,
and exhibits very shallow circuit depths when applied to the specific system of
interest, namely a model Hamiltonian representing a cuprate superconductor.
These features make our approach a favorable candidate for generating good
ground state approximations on current NISQ devices. Our findings illustrate
the potential of VQE algorithmic development for leveraging the full
capabilities of NISQ devices.
